full_summary:
### RFP Facilities Maintenance and Support Services, CFB Halifax

#### Overview

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites proposals from qualified contractors to provide facilities maintenance and support services to the Department of National Defence (DND) for installations located in CFB Halifax, Shearwater, and Dartmouth, Nova Scotia. This contract is a single requirement and is being solicited through an open tendering process.

#### Objective

The successful contractor will be responsible for providing maintenance and support services for all identified buildings and infrastructure within the defined property limits. This includes regular inspections, repairs, and maintenance to ensure that facilities remain in good working condition and do not deteriorate beyond normal wear and tear.

#### Period of Service

The contract will have an initial period of service from the service commencement date to March 2026. The contract may be extended for up to two additional two-year periods and a further two-year period, for a possible total duration of seven years.

#### Security Requirements

The contract falls under the Defence Construction Canada (DCC) security requirements for private sector organizations.

#### Contract Value

The estimated contract value for HX316341 over the possible total duration is approximately $6,000,000.

#### Site Visits

Non-mandatory site visits have been scheduled for interested bidders. To attend a site visit, please register with Jim Payne (jim.payne@dcc-cdc.gc.ca) by March 9, 2023.

#### Contract Award

The contract award will be made based on the evaluation criteria outlined in the request for proposal (RFP).

#### Tender Documents

Tender documents are available on [http://www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com). Please note that fees may apply.

#### Contact Information

For more information, please contact Francis Bélanger, Associate Contracting Authority, Defence Construction Canada (francis.belanger@dcc-cdc.gc.ca, 418-559-2804).

#### Evaluation Criteria

Proposals will be evaluated in accordance with the criteria outlined in the RFP.

#### Exclusion

This tender follows the principles outlined in the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement, the Canada-Europe Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement.'),
